trans-unit.source: Enables and configures object pooling for a component.
This class cannot be inherited.
If object pooling is specified, it must not be disabled in the COM+ catalog; if enabled in the COM+ catalog, it must be specified on the component.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of ObjectPoolingAttribute, see the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ObjectPoolingAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
For more information about using attributes, see [Attributes](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.EnterpriseServices.ObjectPoolingAttribute"></xref> class and sets the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ObjectPoolingAttribute.Enabled*>, <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ObjectPoolingAttribute.MaxPoolSize*>, <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ObjectPoolingAttribute.MinPoolSize*>, and <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ObjectPoolingAttribute.CreationTimeout*> properties to their default values.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ObjectPoolingAttribute>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |Enabled|`true`| |MaxPoolSize|-1| |MinPoolSize|-1| |CreationTimeout|-1|
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.EnterpriseServices.ObjectPoolingAttribute"></xref> class and sets the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ObjectPoolingAttribute.Enabled*> property.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to enable object pooling; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.EnterpriseServices.ObjectPoolingAttribute"></xref> class and sets the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ObjectPoolingAttribute.MaxPoolSize*> and <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ObjectPoolingAttribute.MinPoolSize*> properties.
The minimum pool size.
The maximum pool size.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.EnterpriseServices.ObjectPoolingAttribute"></xref> class and sets the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ObjectPoolingAttribute.Enabled*>, <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ObjectPoolingAttribute.MaxPoolSize*>, and <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ObjectPoolingAttribute.MinPoolSize*> properties.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to enable object pooling; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The minimum pool size.
The maximum pool size.
Called internally by the .NET Framework infrastructure while installing and configuring assemblies in the COM+ catalog.
Even though it is a public method, the AfterSaveChanges method is intended only to be used from within the .NET Framework infrastructure.
It is sufficient for a developer to apply the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ObjectPoolingAttribute> class attribute and set other members in its interface.
A hash table that contains internal objects referenced by internal keys.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the method has made changes.
Called internally by the .NET Framework infrastructure while applying the <xref href="System.EnterpriseServices.ObjectPoolingAttribute"></xref> class attribute to a serviced component.
Even though it is a public method, the Apply method is intended only to be used from within the .NET Framework infrastructure.
It is sufficient for a developer to apply the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ObjectPoolingAttribute> class attribute and set other members in its interface.
A hash table that contains an internal object to which object pooling properties are applied, referenced by an internal key.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true " name="true " href=""></xref>if the method has made changes.
Gets or sets the length of time to wait for an object to become available in the pool before throwing an exception.
This value is in milliseconds.
Specifies how long a client will wait, in milliseconds, for an object to be returned from the pool.
The time-out value in milliseconds.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether object pooling is enabled.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if object pooling is enabled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Called internally by the .NET Framework infrastructure while installing and configuring assemblies in the COM+ catalog.
Even though it is a public method, the IsValidTarget method is intended only to be used from within the .NET Framework infrastructure.
It is sufficient for a developer to apply the <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ObjectPoolingAttribute> class attribute and set other members in its interface.
A string generated by the .NET Framework infrastructure that is checked for a special value that indicates a serviced component.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the attribute is applied to a serviced component class.
Gets or sets the value for the maximum size of the pool.
MaxPoolSize represents the maximum number of pooled objects that the pooling manager will create, both actively used by clients and inactive in the pool.
When creating objects, the pooling manager checks to verify that the maximum pool size has not been reached and, if it has not, the pooling manager creates a new object to dispense to the client.
If the maximum pool size has been reached, client requests are queued and receive the first available object from the pool in the order in which they arrived.
Object creation requests time-out after a specified period.
The maximum number of objects in the pool.
Gets or sets the value for the minimum size of the pool.
MinPoolSize represents the number of objects that are created when the application starts and the minimum number of objects that are maintained in the pool while the application is running.
If the number of available objects in the pool drops below the specified minimum, new objects are created to meet any outstanding object requests and refill the pool.
If the number of available objects in the pool is greater than the minimum number, those surplus objects are destroyed during a clean-up cycle.
The minimum number of objects in the pool.
